channel.title: Interface hover
channel.description:
I made this interface
http://gyazo.com/149509e13f34e009f6bb87c23d5dd512
and the button hovers aren't working...
the interface is hardcoded, what i'm wondering is if im supposed to add the "tab.child(whatever)" in a special order to make them work
btw the pics on the buttons are just transparent images that i added to the code, not individual buttons.
heres how i have my code in rsinterface layed out.
its like this... tab.totalChildren(##); tab.child(id, id, x, y);// unhovered button tab.child(id, id, x, y);// hovered button tab.child(id, id, x, y);//Image sprite

item.title: Interface hover
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ReaperXScape:

ik lol you didn’t read my problem though.

I was making sure you understood how they worked, since what you provided, it looked like you were putting the same id in 2 fields. Which wouldn’t work whatsoever.

And we can’t exactly say shit about how your hovers are working. Since you gave literally no code related to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Interface hover
item.dc:creator: @ReaperXScape ReaperXScape

item.title: Interface hover
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

child works like so:
tab.totalChildren(5);
child(0, 43875, 40, 60);
child(1, 43876, 60, 60);
child(2, 43877, 80, 60);
child(3, 43878, 100, 60);
child(4, 43879, 120, 60);

If that makes sense. The first digit is the id of the interface object for the interface. It’ll be based on how many totalChildren you have. The second is the actual ID of the interface object, like if you made a button for the interface with the ID of 43877, that’s what would go there. And the other 2 are X and Y.

Read full topic

item.title: Interface hover
item.dc:creator: @ReaperXScape ReaperXScape
item.description:
@ReaperXScape wrote:

I made this interface

http://gyazo.com/149509e13f34e009f6bb87c23d5dd512

and the button hovers aren’t working…

the interface is hardcoded, what i’m wondering is if im supposed to add the “tab.child(whatever)” in a special order to make them work

btw the pics on the buttons are just transparent images that i added to the code, not individual buttons.

heres how i have my code in rsinterface layed out.

its like this…
tab.totalChildren(##);
tab.child(id, id, x, y);// unhovered button
tab.child(id, id, x, y);// hovered button
tab.child(id, id, x, y);//Image sprite

Read full topic
